Description: A lead alloy pilgrim badge in the form of a tau cross with a haloed Christ crucified against an inscribed background. In the corners of the cross there are trefoil designs. The inscription runs behind the halo of Christ and reads SIGNUM. The reverse of the badge has an inegrated pin with a clasp which is now broken. At the base of the cross under the feet of Christ there is a small remainder of what would have once been a hoop to hold a bell, now lost.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1998 / Pilgrim Souvenirs and Secular Badges (pp. 176 - 177)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1999 8 Feb-2 Apr, London, Wellcome Institute Library, Renaissance Medicine
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
